result.execSummary:
The defendant Waylon John Brown was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Neglecting a Child, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.21(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or will discharge with outstanding financial obligations due, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due.
Any counseling per the agents recommendations.  Submit DNA sample.

Filed by Atty Leonie Dolch
Filed by ADA Brenda Yaskal

Defendant Waylon John Brown in court with attorney Leonie Dolch.  Brenda L. Yaskal appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Amended complaint filed.  Reading waived.  Rights/Elements.  Defendant pled no contest to amended complaint.  Court found guilty.  Judgment was entered.  Court withheld sentencing placed defendant on probation for 1 year.  Conditions of probation include: $443.00 costs.  Submit DNA sample.  Any counseling per the agents recommendations.  2 days credit.

Defendant Waylon John Brown in court with attorney Leonie Dolch.  Christine Marie Genda appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Dolch requested new return date.  Return date scheduled for May 18, 2016 at 02:45 pm.

Defendant Waylon John Brown in court with attorney Leonie Dolch.  Clifford Chase Burdon appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Victim M.B. and Atty Dolch requesting contact w/V.V.H., State objects to request, Court amends bond to allow defendant to have contact w/children but at all times be supervised by wife, if she leaves home, children are to go w/her, no violent/abusive contact w/any child in the home, required to continue to take medications and provide proof of taking medications, defendant to provide documentation of medication to the Clerk of Courts, defendant to provide the Court documentation of weekly counseling sessions, the day following receipt of the report, it may be faxed,
Appointed Attorney Leonie Dolch

Defendant Waylon John Brown in court, in custody by video with attorney Amanda Riek .  Troy D Cross appeared for the State of Wisconsin. waives reading of complaint, $2,500.00 sign bond, standard felony conditions, no contact w/V.V.H. by any means or her residence, may return to residence one time w/law enforcement to obtain person belongings, defendant to provide DNA Sample, waives time limits to prelim,  Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 26, 2015 at 02:10 pm.
